model_notes.model_1: 4 years horizon; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_2: 4 years horizon; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_3: 10 year horizon instead of 4 years horizon; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_4: 10 year horizon instead of 4 years horizon; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_5: estimates from Table D1 in Appendix; economy is in a boom; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_6: estimates from Table D1 in Appendix; economy is in a slump; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_7: estimates from Table D1 in Appendix; economy is in a boom; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_8: estimates from Table D1 in Appendix; economy is in a slump; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_9: estimates from Table D2 in Appendix; economy is in a high inflation regime; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_10: estimates from Table D2 in Appendix; economy is in a low inflation regime; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947
model_notes.model_11: estimates from Table D2 in Appendix; economy is in a high inflation regime; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_12: estimates from Table D2 in Appendix; economy is in a low inflation regime; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_13: estimates from Table D3 in Appendix; economy is in a high mortage credit growth regime; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_14: estimates from Table D3 in Appendix; economy is in a low mortage credit growth regime; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_15: estimates from Table D3 in Appendix; economy is in a high mortage credit growth regime; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_16: estimates from Table D3 in Appendix; economy is in a low mortage credit growth regime; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_17: estimates from Table D4 in Appendix; economy is in a high non-mortage credit growth regime; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_18: estimates from Table D4 in Appendix; economy is in a low non-mortage credit growth regime; full sample includes 1870–2006 but excluding World War 1 period, from 1914 to 1919 and also excluding World War 2, from 1939 to 1947.
model_notes.model_19: estimates from Table D4 in Appendix; economy is in a high non-mortage credit growth regime; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
model_notes.model_20: estimates from Table D4 in Appendix; economy is in a low non-mortage credit growth regime; only post World War 2 sample, from 1948 to 2006.
